subject: Is JavaFX Outdated/Dead?
context: I would like to response to the question by a student mentioned JavaFX is outdated which was read from article online. This is a great question! First of all, we are not emphasing on GUI implementation in this module, that would be for HCI module in P2 (Year 4). In fact, JavaFX serves as a good tool for teaching the design patterns and principles. Secondly, JavaFX is open-source, and have more developers contributed to its development over the past few years, which is worth to be utilised. Third, more applications developed require high intensive and requirements of graphic quality such as games that are more suitable with other (specific) languages. JavaFX is more lightweight compared to those, and stays popular in many industries, especially on applications that high computational/complex GUI is not mandatory. If someday JavaFX has started to involve games development, it could be different story.I hope this answer the question, and clear the doubt of using JavaFX in this module. Again, focus on the developing maintainable software with design patterns and principles we learnt in this module, instead of programming language.Reference: https://www.javaadvent.com/2019/12/javafx-not-dead-yet.html.

subject: JavaFX SDK VM Setting
context: Sample Error Message:����: �Ҳ������޷��������� Files\Java\javafx-sdk-15\lib ԭ��: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: Files\Java\javafx-sdk-15\lib I think the problem might be that the address I place my javafx is "C:\Program Files\Java\javafx-sdk-15\lib", and there is a blank between the words "Program" and "Files". In addition, I notice that in the "VM option" part, which ask us to replace sample address with ous, it regard the "blank" as a new line. Consequently, the error message says "ClassNotFoundException: Files\Java\javafx-sdk-15\lib". Looking forward to your help.Potential solutions:You need to include the quote symbols, e.g. "C:\Program Files\Java\javafx-sdk-15\lib" instead of C:\Program Files\Java\javafx-sdk-15\lib. In addition, be aware to put a space after --module-path and before --add-modules arguments.

subject: Coursework: Late Submission & Concerns
context: It is to remind that all updates on Moodle submission and git repository after 7th Dec. 5pm will be considered as LATE SUBMISSION. For the concerns below,"How many marks will be deduct for late submission" -- Please refer to UNNC coursework/assignment late submission policy."I didn't do this, I didn't do that, something wrong with my git ..., how many marks will be deducted?" -- All these need further verification when we start the marking, and we can't answer you now even you keep emailing us for mark deduction confirmation."I do not know this, I don't aware of that, I didn't realise ..., is this acceptable?" -- You have been given more than 6 weeks to complete your coursework, and plenty of opportunities for you to raise your questions, so these excuses will not be considered as valid defenses against your mark after released."I don't have enough time to complete the coursework because of XXX reasons" -- Unless proven and approved by faculty office, these excuses will also not be considered as valid defenses against your mark after released as 6 weeks are reasonable and more than sufficient time for you to complete the coursework. You must and should already have develop & practice good time management skill.Initially, we have advised students to start earlier and complete the coursework at earliest time possible, make sure everything works on a day before submission. It is very challenging and difficult for us to handle all the issues in the last minutes. Once again, please be aware all updates to either Moodle submission or Git repository will be considered as LATE SUBMISSION.

subject: Coursework: Additions
context: Common question by students in additions:Q1: Do we need to complete the functions such as load game, save game, toggle music etc. provided in the menu bar?A1: Yes. This is relate to "Corrective Maintenance" in Lecture 1 which is to finding and fixing errors in the software.Q2: Can I change how the load and save functions work? Can I modify the data changed?A2: I believe many have experiences in playing games. Have you think and consider how the game is saved or loaded? I think not. Players mostly concerned if the game is successfully saved or loaded. Thus, applying with "Adaptive Maintenance" and "Perfective Maintenance" concepts, you can made any changes you like as long as the behavior is maintained.Q3: Can I add this, can I add that, is that OK to add this, is that fine?A3: You are always welcomed to add anything you want to the game as long as you justify those in your markdown file(s).Q4: This coursework is 75%, it is too much work and too difficult.A4: Life is tough, employment is getting more difficult and challenging. As educators, we aim to prepare and equip students with necessary skills for future career. This coursework motivates on developing students ability to apply learning concepts (in lectures) into practical uses (coursework - Q1 & Q2), promoting problem-solving and ability of self-evaluate judgement (e.g. is this addition good as stated in the rubric?) capabilities (Q2 & Q3), and enhance students' critical thinking (Q3). Lastly, the coursework was designed and moderated by UK and UM campuses. Providing easy coursework will not help and incapable to meet our intended learning outcomes. We scarify our brain cells, potentially losing lots of our hairs, and sincerely hope students can understand we are always trying our best on providing the best opportunities for our students to achieve the essential skills for future employment.

subject: Coursework: Class Diagram
context: Dear sir,   I have threequestion for class diagram:  1. Do we need to add text description( e.g. has a.., create a...) for following relationships: dependency, association, aggregation, composition?  2.  In class Diagram, do we need to add type of dependency(e.g. <<use>>/ <<abstract>>/<<bind>>)  for dependecy relation?   3. For which of the following relationships, we need to mark their number(multiplicity): dependency, association, aggregation, composition? In the given example of Zoo System, it didn't show the multiplicity of relation, but the specification ask us to add multiplicity to class diagram.(Edited by BOON GIIN LEE - original submission Tuesday, 1 December 2020, 6:32 PM)

subject: Coursework: Unit Test
context: Some students are struggle with the unit testing. Common questions are what to test, and how to test on JavaFX. You can refer to the references below:This video demonstrates how to write Junit test code in Java, especially with questions "how to test a method with multiple internal methods".This site shows very good example how to perform unit test on JavaFX.Lastly, I want to take this opportunity to encourage everyone to focus on completing the lab exercises during lab sessions as these will help you to understand how to work on your coursework. Lab exercises are made with intention as  helper to your coursework. Sometimes, the solution/answer you seek are in those exercises.

subject: Coursework: Good Git Commit Messages
context: A student raises a good question of "How to write good Git messages?". You can refer to detail guideline here (including examples), or short version guideline (summary) here. In general:Specify the type of commit:feat: The new feature you're adding to a particular application.fix: A bug fix.style: Feature and updates related to styling.refactor: Refactoring a specific section of the codebase.test: Everything related to testing.docs: Everything related to documentation.chore: Regular code maintenance.Separate the subject from the body with a blank line.Commit message should not contain any whitespace errors.Remove unnecessary punctuation marks.Do not end the subject line with a period.Capitalize the subject line and each paragraph.Use the imperative mood in the subject line.Use the body to explain what changes you have made and why you made them.DO NOT assume the reviewer understands what the original problem was, ensure you add it.DO NOT think your code is self-explanatory.Follow the commit convention defined by the team.

subject: Coursework: Branch Utilization in GitLab
context: We have encountered dozen of students came to us asking "What's wrong with my program, it can't work suddenly, and I can't redo it."This is one of the many reasons of using version control -- branching in GitLab repository. It is not harm to create branch to work on the project and merge to the master branch once a stable version is achieved (after all testing are passed). Of course, one can also re-roll the "older" code from the Git server using specific git commands.Nonetheless, we would like to remind students that the benefit and advantages of utilizing branches in GitLab repository to help in maintaining the code during implementation and/or refactoring. Please to remind that this is one of the important criteria for coursework evaluation.

subject: Coursework: Refactoring Tips
context: We have covered the refactoring skill in yesterday class, and we believe students should have understand general principles of refactoring. To get students starting on performing code refactoring on the coursework, do refer to "Refactoring Roadmap" at lecture slide 8, pg. 14. Start with "Quick Wins" and further up to "Inject Quality" approaches. To identify the codes that need refactoring, refer to "Identifying Code Smells" at lecture slide 8, pg. 16, which provide guidance of "smelling" bad code, and refactoring methods that students should considered (refer to examples and reading references provided in the slides). This should give the students sufficient idea on where to start code refactoring.

javafx.graphics/com.sun.glass.ui.win.WinApplication._runLoop(Native Method)at javafx.graphics/com.sun.glass.ui.win.WinApplication.lambda$runLoop$3(WinApplication.java:174)	... 1 moreException running application Main----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------The error is due to code that intended to read file from Java project resources folder. As I assume students just copied all the folders directly into the IDE project, the resources folder is only considered as normal directory. To resolve this issue, go to "File -> Project Structure -> Modules", click on the resources folder inside "src/main", click on "Resources" under "Language Level -> Mark As". The resources folder icon should now be changed and configured as Java project resources folder. Click "Apply -> OK", and the application should run without error now.If anyone have copied the source files into the directory separately (not whole folder), this issue/error does not occur.

subject: Coursework: Worries About New Concepts
context: We have received the comments on worrying about the new concepts introduced in the coursework that haven't been covered yet. Firstly, we have make earlier announcement before (do check your email frequently and read the announcement carefully), e.g. the OO design principles/patterns will be covered in next week lecture.As the coursework involves different evaluation criteria, i.e. design principles/patterns, refactoring etc., it was expected for students to apply the "fresh hot" relevant knowledge to the coursework weekly. Considering this, it is a good opportunity to practice on tasks division and planning, similarly to work planning in GRP.The timetable schedule has been posted under "Module Information" in Moodle page for the purpose of letting students to have early expectations on coming lectures. Do refer to the table, it is there for reasons. In addition, considering some contents are only covered in later lectures, there are extra 3 weeks provided after all relevant lectures to complete the coursework.We hope this explanations reduce the students' anxiety and worries in completing coursework. However, if this planning is not satisfied, feel free to approach us for further discussion. We encourage students to approach us to sort out the problem directly, so we can provide the solution in best and fastest way possible. Lastly, for students that wish to raise their concerns/comments privately, we have created extra link under Coursework section to get Q&A from students if discussion forum is not preferred.

subject: Coursework: Class Diagram Documentation
context: For students having questions with class diagram documentation in coursework, a good reference is provided in lecture slide 02 (week 4), starting page 42 - "Case Study: Zoo Management". You can extract (part of class diagrams) and discuss those classes & their interrelations (i.e. slide 56 to 59) in README.md to demonstrate applied OO design principles/patterns (will cover in next week lecture, October 26th, 2020) and GUI design principles/patterns in the coursework along with the implemented Java codes. Be aware that your explanations should be reflected on discussion of i.e. type (and reason) of relationships, classes involved, and applied design principles (if applicable).Hope this help! :D
